website_summaries.verdict: If you activate this beacon, the authorities will come to save you.
pros: Includes a built-in strobe light for night rescues
cons: The unit is pre-programmed to the U.S. country code, which may make it impractical for some locations

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious of manufacturer’s date!
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received was 4 years old. This is unacceptable given the cost and the fact that the battery only has a shelf life of 8-10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Factory seal was broken, had been used/returned
customer_reviews.text: Reveiw not based on product functionality, just when I received the package the seal was broken and it was obviously used/returned. When something's purpose is to save your life and you can't change the batteries, and advertised as new, it should be factory sealed/new. Seems like a common reveiw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsealed/Open Box
customer_reviews.text: I should have heeded the warning of other reviewers. I didn't think it would happen to me, but the product indeed arrived open box/unsealed. It is being returned. FYI: After making the return, I went to my local camping store and purchased the unit in a new, unopened, and sealed box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t had to use it yet
customer_reviews.text: Strapped it to my inflatable PFD, along with an ACR strobe and whistle. Hopefully I will never have to use it but feel safer with it since I boat alone frequently
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: ACR is who to trust
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Hope I never need to. We use ACR in all of our aircraft and I can attest that they work in back country incidents. They make great products and have good customer service. Not a toy and if you need to count on it for life and death don't gamble on 3rd party service. Get the best that does one thing. And does it well. I have set off ACR ELTs more than once on accident in the aircraft and that phone is ringing within minutes every time.
customer_reviews.author: HeloMech

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product, cheaply made and too many reviews of device not working
customer_reviews.text: The antennae latch wouldn't hold the antennae in place for more than two seconds. This is a very cheaply made device. The seller of the product on Amazon (not the manufacturer) did not respond to my inquiry as to how to fix the latch. No response from their customer service. If you care about your life in a life threatening situation, buy something else. I've returned mine, got the refund, and will be purchasing something reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Jean L.

customer_reviews.title: this is a PRE-JUDGEMENT as I've never needed to use it (YET)
customer_reviews.text: this is an insurance item, so hopefully I never need to use it, so until that time (when you need it) I can only assume that it is a 5. If it fails when I need to use it, then I'll update this review at that time. Like a parachute you hope it will work when you need it ;)
customer_reviews.author: Standard Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Insurance
customer_reviews.text: This is one product I hope never to use. As a commercial boat captain I sometimes work in risky environments and I keep this in the pocket of my inflatable PFD just in case I go overboard. It doesn't do any two-way communication or Google mapping like other PLBs out there but there are no recurring fees I need to worry about either.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter S.

customer_reviews.title: A HIGHLY RECOMMENDED potential lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: One should ALWAYS carry this unit with them when out "in the field" where there is any risk of getting lost or having an emergency where needed help might be difficult to obtain. It can SAVE YOUR LIFE of that of loved one. I highly recommend this unit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Westy

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Have not used hopefully I will not have to. Will have it just in case registration was super easy. Coast guard friend said it is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The ResQLink allows me to hike my remote property with no cell service alone when I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Happy1

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to configure online, nice and compact, fits in my dry bag with my emergency gear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had to use it yet (praise Cthulu) but have ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use it yet (praise Cthulu) but have successfully tested it twice and it reports that all is well. It's small, light, and attaches almost anywhere. What more can be said?
customer_reviews.author: Keith H

customer_reviews.title: Ended up returning this item
customer_reviews.text: At no fault of the item, but my husband did not feel this was a device that would work for him as a scuba diver.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Adams

customer_reviews.title: Makes me feel safer when hiking
customer_reviews.text: I like the peace of mind that this gives me when I hike alone, or even with friends. I asked the owner of a mountain guiding business in the White Mountains which unit was the most reliable, and he said this one. The battery expires 1/2023, so a nice long life. Hopefully I'll never need to use it now!
customer_reviews.author: moskigirl

customer_reviews.title: Expires 2025?  It says Feb 19 after the serial number so batts don't last as the larger EPIRBS.
customer_reviews.text: Small, might even fit in My Mc Murdo dive canister.
customer_reviews.author: Soaring

customer_reviews.title: This is a must for long distance sailing.
customer_reviews.text: This will save you live,small and light. A plus at night wen some one gous offer bord it can be picked up on chart plotter if set up korectly.
customer_reviews.author: Diaan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Ive done my research and this plb is outstanding. I have given this as a gift and it has absolutely has helped me sleep better at night. I will purchase 5 more this year for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the outdoorsman.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to operate. Peace of mind when the nearest help is a day or two away. Backpacking with my sons is always an adventure-from scaling 12,000 foot mountains to fording raging streams 2-3 times their normal size. Glad to finally have the ACR this year.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a good product for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good product. Arrived on time, and I installed it in my "ditch bag" for use in an emergency. I can only hope that it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Dogparty

customer_reviews.title: Personal  Locator Beacon...
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my Mt climbing son .....he loves it and I feel more confident knowing if he needs assistance , this item will not only summon help but also reveal his location !
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Hope I never need it
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. Design seems very smart. Easy to test. Light weight but appears durable. Registration was easy. Hopefully it's all for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: KRISTOFER R SCHOEFFLER

customer_reviews.title: easy to understand and use
customer_reviews.text: The ACR PLB 375 is compact, easy to understand and use, light small and comfortable to wear on your inflatable vest, did not need to use it on a trans gulf voyage but enjoyed the peace of mind that I had it on. Also My wife who was not aboard slept much better knowing I was wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger

customer_reviews.title: How can one place a price on one's life? ...
customer_reviews.text: How can one place a price on one's life? I offshore fish in Florida and this device certainly should be on every boat.
customer_reviews.author: ShowMeTheShrimp

customer_reviews.title: could save my life so I sucked up and bought it - haven't regretted the decision
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it - but seems good. I'll update if used in the field. waterproof is a big plus and take it on camping trips - a little money for piece of mind and, if unlucky, could save my life. A no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact design and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I read tons of review about this product and it seems to be the gold standard for personal locator beacons. Nice compact design and easy to use. I trust this machine but hope I never have to use it! Shipper delivered exactly as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not an EPIRP
customer_reviews.text: Good beacon - not an EPIRP(which is required for certain fishing vessels)
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Tested just fine.
customer_reviews.text: After hearing some horror stories I wouldn't leave the dock without on of these PLB's. Light weight and comes with a Velcro strap to attach to just about anything you want. Unit was recently made so battery expiration date was very reasonable. Tested just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comapct PLB
customer_reviews.text: Much, much smaller and less expensive than the previous generation of ACR PLBs. I carry one in my backpack all the time. So far I never had to use a PLB, so I don't know from first-hand experience how the system works.
customer_reviews.author: PeterB37

customer_reviews.title: This device is a must have if you are hiking ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is a must have if you are hiking, biking, or traveling in harsh winter conditions. It is very compact, and you forget it's there. ( Until you need it, of course. )
customer_reviews.author: Rmarkes

customer_reviews.title: Proven product, worth all the money
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Must have for any offshore fisherman or extreme adventurers
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D.

customer_reviews.title: No excuse not to get one if you fish the deep blue....
customer_reviews.text: Small, about the size of an old flip phone but twice as thick, waterproof and floats. Has clear instructions on how to register with NOAA and how to use. Gives me some reassurance in case something were to happen while out solo fishing on my boat. Cheap enough that everyone while out fishing in the ocean should have one, for you and your family's sake.
customer_reviews.author: Shinnosuke

customer_reviews.title: but it was easy to test and set
customer_reviews.text: Hope I never have to use it, but it was easy to test and set up
customer_reviews.author: DRB

customer_reviews.title: this is compact and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: hope to never need it. this is compact and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Luby

customer_reviews.title: The antennae keeps pooping out of its spring clip and ...
customer_reviews.text: The antennae keeps pooping out of its spring clip and getting in the way. This makes it hard to wear, if not impossible
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: tests fine. great to have, hope you'll never need it
customer_reviews.author: Crew

customer_reviews.title: May be a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice. What can I say, I haven't needed to use it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: I never get on any boat or go hicking without my PLB.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Get one already.....
customer_reviews.text: Never go out into the backcountry without one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I hope I never get to use this product. It's small and fits great in my jeans pocket along with my cell phone. Registration with both the manufacturer and NOAA was an easy process. Look and feels like a great, solid product. I always carry it on my work trips offshore.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A must have piece of equipment for the solo boater
customer_reviews.author: HWS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works as advertised. Best deal for life saving equipment.
customer_reviews.author: joe burchfield

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviewers I hope I never have to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers I hope I never have to use it, but I like the peace of mind being out in the gulf with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment I Ever Made
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I ever bought for boating. It offers great peace of mind and I wouldn't go out on the water without it. The support is phenomenal and the product is even better. If you're out on the water you should definitely have this device.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: He hasn't had to use it (yet) but we both feel better knowing his chances of being rescued in the event ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Hubby so I can have some peace of mind when he runs off with his kayak for a few "wildman" days alone in the woods and marshes. He hasn't had to use it (yet) but we both feel better knowing his chances of being rescued in the event an accident/problem are greatly increased.
customer_reviews.author: Morning Glory

customer_reviews.title: great product but mine had been opened...possible returned
customer_reviews.text: Mine had clearly been opened. The tape sealing the box at the flap that closed the box had been cut and the manual was missing. Everything else seems fine. Hoping it is new and in perfect order if I ever have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Alone? You need this!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! As I travel through the woods alone quite often, I decided to purchase this PLB "just in case". I tested it (free test) and it worked perfectly. The quality is there (it had better be because your life may depend on it) and I feel much better going into the woods now. The government setup was easy too. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: WV Radio Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Personal Locator Beacon (PLB), But Needs Better Antenna Storage
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this PLB is great, except the antenna storage. The antenna does not stay hooked into the plastic notch for normal storage, which is a bummer, because it is almost always being stowed away... Unless there's an emergency or I'm using the onboard test features. Obviously it's easy to remedy with a rubber band, or other options, but it still seems like a design flaw to be addressed. Regardless, I feel confident this product could save my life if necessary, and it's very comforting to have with me in the backcountry.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: How does one rate a product you hope to never use?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ResQLink for a two week hike I am taking alone in the mountains. I did a significant amount of research before purchasing this, and I found this to be the highest recommended emergency beacon on the market. Plus, you just buy it and do not have to pay for any minutes. I hope I never have to use it, but it is pretty cheap insurance when all alone in the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy Dog

customer_reviews.title: ACR PLB-375 ResQLink+ Personal Locator Beacon
customer_reviews.text: Great solution to get portable global 406mhz satellite/gps emergency beacon capability, whether for aviation, boating, hiking, etc. Price is a little high but is offset by the fact that no subscription is required to use the device. Must be registered with NOAA/SARSAT before use. Be aware to use it only in the event of a dire emergency as a "false alarm" would be very costly in the event rescue services converge on your location only to find it was not an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Flying4905

customer_reviews.title: It would have been nice to include it to help keep the antenna in ...
customer_reviews.text: would have gave them 5 stars but now I have to purchase the case that goes with it separately. It would have been nice to include it to help keep the antenna in place.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Robb

customer_reviews.title: Better safe than sorry!
customer_reviews.text: Well I love the idea of this thing. I hope I never have to find out how well it actually works, but from everything we researched, it seems that if we were to get ourselves in a sticky situation where our lives are in danger and we need help, this is the device to have. A bit tedious to get it registered and all that, but I think if the time comes that I have a broken leg half way up a mountain, it will have been worth those few minutes of my time. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis Kronk

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for personal safety.
customer_reviews.text: In addition to my ACR EPIRB for my boat, I bought this personal locator beacon, which I strap to my belt every time I go boating. Added safety - if you are tossed from your boat, the boat's EPIRB won't help - or save - you. Pricey but great quality - is it worth the risk not to have one?
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: ... received my PLB and it appears to be in good shape. I had no issues registering it with ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my PLB and it appears to be in good shape. I had no issues registering it with the government. I've yet to use it or test it, which is something I should have done before using it in Alaska. The next time I go hiking in a more rural area I plan on doing the first test to see how the signal is.
customer_reviews.author: MidwestGuy

customer_reviews.title: An excellent device and I hope I never have to use it!
customer_reviews.text: This PLB is extremely small and very easy to operate. The unit has a 5-year battery and is designed to take some abuse. I bought it for an aircraft ditch kit but am also planning on storing it while motorcycling in remote areas. It is truly an "insurance policy" and I hope that I never have to use it!
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use it, but seems fairly simple and well made. The manual is kinda cryptic to say the least. Must be a literal translation from a Chinese language manual or something. A person should be able to read a well written manual in a few minutes and totally understand the product. Not the case here.
customer_reviews.author: RONALD

customer_reviews.title: Good but no UPC
customer_reviews.text: This is really a 5 star product but I bought it from a 2 star Amazon seller so I rated it a 4. ACR is great and this thing could be a life saver. I bought it while there was a $50 rebate going on and when I received this from the Amazon seller the UPC had been torn off. Cant get the rebate without the UPC. So I returned this to Amazon and bought one from West Marine.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Valuable device
customer_reviews.text: Very valuable electronic device. I hope I will never have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Infotraker

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit. Fortunately, I have not had to use it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jose S.

customer_reviews.title: Better safe than sorry
customer_reviews.text: Bought one a couple years ago for my wife and another one recently for my solo-hiking adult son. Makes me more comfortable with loved ones having one of these while they're out in the wilderness.
customer_reviews.author: virusur

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have on board
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have on board. While on the water in Hatteras NC we heard the coast guard announce the activation of a personal locator 7 miles southeast of ocracoke inlet over the radio. They had all the info they needed to mount a quick rescue. Proof they work.
customer_reviews.author: sp

customer_reviews.title: United States registration code a random sticker on box
customer_reviews.text: Warning WARNING WARNOING: ACCORDING TO NOAA, the beacon cannot be verified as being able to work in the United States. You are running a huge risk if you use this in the United States. The beacon I received is a UK beacon and the Hex (shown as UIN on tags) code used to register the beacon is not the code listed on the beacon itself or in the instructions. Rather the United States code necessary to register the beacon is non-descriptly shown as: "US Hex 15: 2A4E8A........." on a sticker on the box. YOU ARE TAKING A HUGE RISK IF YOU USE THIS IN THE UNITED STATES!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Don't be dumb. Anybody who is outdoorsy should carry one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Stein k engen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up registration online with NOAA. Used this for my tsunami Survival Capsule.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanneinks

customer_reviews.title: this is a great item, only issue I had was registration in ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a great item, only issue I had was registration in Australia, I had to have the PLB reprogrammed to meet Australian apporval which was not cheap to do. To use a USA approved PLB in Australia is not allowed which is quite disappointing for anyone travelling the world, effectively it means every country one visits & wishes to have a PLB compliant they would have to buy a new unit for each country or spend the money have their unit reprogrammed every time!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't rely on anyone but yourself and buddy.
customer_reviews.text: Well at lock and dam #2 on Mississippi River in life threatening conditions it didn't work. My buddy set it off and swears did it correctly and it's a piece of junk. I couldn't do it because my hands were too numb so lesson don't wait too long as it should have a lever for numb hands.??? Still alive because I could still hold on and paddle. Lucky me. In retrospect I should have used a marine radio and not this. This seemed good as small and battery not a problem as it could be with radio. From now on a radio is my choice on the river.
customer_reviews.author: Mikebudd

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can't know if it gets 5 stars until I need it ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it yet, but I feed much safer having it
customer_reviews.text: You can't put a price on safety, and unexpected circumstances can mean life and death in the wilderness. I feel much safer having this device with me, especially when I'm alone in the backcountry, or driving through a remote area. Fortunately I haven't had to use it. But if I ever do run into a legit emergency and use it, they will replace it for free, which is awesome. Just be careful to not activate it without a serious emergency, because you may get charged for an unnecessary search and rescue operation, which won't be cheap.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bird

customer_reviews.title: The peace of mind is well worth the price. ...
customer_reviews.text: The peace of mind is well worth the price. I have not used it and I hope I never will!
customer_reviews.author: David M Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A must have for boating or hunting in remote areas.
customer_reviews.author: E. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great offshore PLB
customer_reviews.text: It's small enough so you can clip it to your PFD. The TEST email notification feature is priceless. I used to keep my family updated on my trip to Bermuda. Worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need
customer_reviews.text: As a trail runner running alone in very remote areas of the Colorado Rockies, I needed something just in case I get into some trouble and have no cell service. The PLB-375 is exactly what I needed. It's small, lightweight and powerful. And it provides the security and piece of mind to make a remote trail run more fun.
customer_reviews.author: JimSuss_Editor

customer_reviews.title: Need training to use, great otherwise
customer_reviews.text: The size and published capabilities are great, and one use would sure more than pay the price of this handy little device. Not having used it, I can't attest to how well it works but there's no reason to suspect it wouldn't bring help quickly. The only drawback is that my friends & family had no idea how to work it until I showed them several times. In a real emergency I'm not confident they'd remember how to activate the beacon, and it's not clearly marked on the unit. Even so, I'm very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone looking for the least expensive full-fledged rescue beacon.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Most by far recommend this brand
customer_reviews.text: Did ton of resarch and talk to lots of commercial captains. Most by far recommend this brand. I had SPOT before, Got in trouble in high seas, boat capsized. Activated my SPOT and hours later nothing. After we where rescued by passing boat, I call SPOT and they told me that "this is not really designed for rescue, mostly like novelty item". I call coast guard and they never got call for SPOT and that told me to get rid of it and get real stuff, which i did.Did not use it yet :), but I'm comfortable it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Sasa Bratic

customer_reviews.title: Gift for our son...peace of mind for us.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to rate something you hope your son will never use, but after reading I decided on this PLB due to its small size and that it floats. We were afraid he might be offended thinking we don't think he can take care of himself on his trips to the middle of nowhere, but he was thrilled. There's no yearly fee, unless he wants to send, "I'm ok" to his wife daily. He started reading the instructions and it said they would replace it if you ever have to use it! That and the peace of mind any PLB brings is why I gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ilovekittycats

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Its great but does it have to be so fat to be floatable? I like that it has areas to attach it unlike the previous model but man it really increases the size of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Order the 9521 Pouch
customer_reviews.text: This floating "ResQLink+" product appears to work perfectly for the intended use. However, do not fall victim (as I did) to the numerous suggestions on the Amazon website that you also order the #9521 "floating pouch". I just wanted something to protect the unit from damage. The #9521 pouch only fits the much thinner (non-floating) "ResQLink" model. I could not find a pouch for the "ResQLink+" model anywhere. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: WaggRnch1

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed to work
customer_reviews.text: Unit failed to work. However, I deeply appreciate that Amazon accepted a return of the unit. Given the importance of this kind of beacon being absolutely reliable, I am profoundly disappointed that a non-working unit was sent to me.
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Received box that had already been opened. Most likely had been returned already. I also returned it
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to Back it Up!!!!
customer_reviews.text: When you ride your ski in the biggest ocean in the world, and like going out alone, you better have back up, back up, back up. Besides having a float plan, cell phone, vhf radio, a PLB, is your best resort to survival. The thing that you're happy to have, but wish you never have to use it. You must be thinking about a buddy system, you're right, but you're out there and just so happen a whale smack both of you at the same time, then where's your back up now? Buddy or not, remember back-up, back-up back-up.
customer_reviews.author: DK Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Not NEW!
customer_reviews.text: Products factory seal was already broken, seems that someone opened the box before me.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Missing items?!?!?!?
customer_reviews.text: I can only give this one star because I received an opened box that is clearly missing parts. The self test says the unit is in satisfactory condition. The manual it came with references a strap for attaching it to things like a back pack or belt. It didn't come with a strap. The manual also says to remove it from its pouch prior to operation. It didn't come with that either. Kind of disappointing when your spending this kind of money.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: must buy
customer_reviews.text: if you travel anywhere remote this is a must buy. just like life insurance, you hope you never need it but it is good to have
customer_reviews.author: carson

customer_reviews.title: I'll let you know...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but it makes my wife happy.
customer_reviews.author: MoeAlfa

customer_reviews.title: Don't Count the the $50 Rebate ... SCAM WARNING
customer_reviews.text: The PLB seems like a good idea. don't know if it actually works yet, fortunately. Don't, however, buy this thinking that you will get a $50 rebate from the manufacturer. I did receive a debit card in the mail, which wouldn't activate online. I called the phone number listed on the card and it turns out that there is an "activation fee" as well as some sort of monthly fee. They wanted my phone number...hahaha. TOTAL SCAM....
customer_reviews.author: Billybob

customer_reviews.title: Could have done better on price other than that I will tell you ...
customer_reviews.text: Could have done better on price other than that I will tell you how good it is when I need it to work!!!
customer_reviews.author: tom hume

customer_reviews.title: Failed to operate
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and recieved the unit it failed the operating test so I returned it for another unit and it also failed its operation test. So I returned the second unit for a refund and Amazon charged me a 20 percent restocking fee.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS BY PERSONAL EXPERIENCE
customer_reviews.text: My boat capsized offshore at 11:31 am. I turned on the signal. The colonel from the coast guard called my wife in the next 2-3 minutes to confirm that I was out fishing. The coast guard helicopter was sent to my location immediately. The helicopter was there very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Old battery in a new ELT
customer_reviews.text: The unit appears to work as desired but I was disappointed that the 5 year battery has only 2 years left on it.
customer_reviews.author: TD in KC

customer_reviews.title: Antenna keeps popping apart!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but right out of the box I can not get the antenna to stay secured! I keep clipping the two ends together and it keeps popping apart! How is that going to work when I attach the beacon to something!? I have to tie it together!
customer_reviews.author: M Hope

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you are a hard core racer you must get one of these it will save your life
customer_reviews.author: travis

customer_reviews.title: Not broken just a poor design. When I clip the antenna into its ...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this locator beacon five stars but the antenna hold down clip was defective. Not broken just a poor design. When I clip the antenna into its storage position it pops out in about 30 seconds. I just leave the antenna up. As far as the rest of the product it appears to be of very good quality and design. A great little product for the price. If you go boating any distance off shore you should always have a locator beacon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All good.
customer_reviews.text: Best price for the product. Though it came from the UK it was correctly registered for the US. Also came with full battery. All registered, let's hope I never have to use it, ha!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sense of security for emergency situations
customer_reviews.text: Just love having this. We used it all summer while hiking in remote areas in Glacier National Park. And we will use it for our climbing excursions too, since often they are in remote areas here in Nevada. It was easy to set up, and is a great sense of security when out "there".
customer_reviews.author: SCwolves

customer_reviews.title: The usefulness of this beacon in the forested areas of ...
customer_reviews.text: The usefulness of this beacon in the forested areas of the Shenandoah National Park is extremely limited due to the tree cover. It would have been helpful if the information on the use of this product would mention that it does not operate properly in forested areas. This fact was explained in the inbox pamphlet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ford, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good to have in the mountains.
customer_reviews.text: I haven‘t had to use it yet. Hope I never have to. For mountain hiking. Glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R, Hollingshead

customer_reviews.title: Product is backed by a great warranty. If you ever have to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have never had to use mine. (knock on wood). The registration was straight forward and quick. The size is slightly larger than I would prefer when mounted on my PFD, but fits well. I trust the product will work when the time comes to use it. Product is backed by a great warranty. If you ever have to use it they will replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice sense of safety
customer_reviews.text: My GF insisted that I purchase this as I roamed around out west by myself. It appears to have all the necessary features and fits nicely in a daypack. I really hope that I never actually know IF it works.
customer_reviews.author: Willy T

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully we will never truly have to use it but I certainly feel better that I know my husband carries it on all ...
customer_reviews.text: I rate it a 5 b/c it arrived on time and we registered it with no issues. Hopefully we will never truly have to use it but I certainly feel better that I know my husband carries it on all his fishing trips.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent product to carry around in the backcountry hiking, skiing, or whatever
customer_reviews.author: Boris Clemens

product_meta.title: ACR PLB-375 ResQLink+ 406 Buoyant Personal Locator Beacon
product_meta.description: The ACR ResQLink+ PLB-375 Personal Locator Beacon is the world's smallest PLB, and it floats! At 5.4 oz, the ResQLink+ weighs less than a couple of PowerBars. And topping at just 4.5 inches, it's smaller than the cell phone in your pocket. Small and mighty, the ResQLink+ is a full-powered, GPS-enabled rescue beacon designed for boaters, pilots and water-borne sportsmen. With three levels of integrated signal technology -GPS positioning, a powerful 406 MHz signal, and 121.5 MHz homing capability - the ResQLink quickly and accurately relays your position to a worldwide network of search and rescue satellites. A built-in strobe light provides visibility during night rescues. Even in extreme conditions and situations, the ResQLink activates easily. Just deploy the antenna and press the ON button. With its powerful 66 channel GPS, the ResQLink guides rescuers to within 100 meters or less of your position. And, in the continental U.S., search and rescue personnel are typically alerted of your position in as little as five minutes with a GPS-enabled PLB such as the ResQLink. Two built-in tests allow you to routinely verify that the ResQLink is functioning and ready for use - with the push of a button, you can easily test internal electronics and GPS functionality. The unit features a small size of 1.9"W x 4.5"H x 1.6"D and has a non-hazmat battery for easy shipping. The battery is certified for six years and has a typical shelf life of 11 years. The ResQLink+ is manually deployed and has a five year warranty. Included in the box is the ResQLink+, registration forms (required), and owner's manual.
feature_bullets: All Personal Locator Beacons sold by US are pre-programmed with the US country code.
This PLB should only be used in situations of grave and imminent danger to life. False alerts endanger lives and cause expensive disruption to Search & Rescue services.
Deliberate misuse of the device could result in a penalty. Antenna clip

Unlike most satellite enabled notification devices, the ACR ResQLink+ PLB requires no monthly or annual subscription, making it one of the most cost effective GPS enabled emergency beacons available for long term use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars327 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Wireless communication technologies: 406 MHz Distress Signal, 121.5 MHz Homing Signal, GPS
